hero-desc: The 365orthodoxy Widget is an elegant digital calendar and a source of daily spiritual serenity. It brings the wisdom of the Holy Scriptures, Patristic Texts, and the lives of our Saints directly to your device.
why-desc: In a noisy digital world, 365orthodoxy acts as a beacon of peace and inspiration. Our goal is to create an easy-to-use tool that offers knowledge and food for thought.
f1-d: A carefully curated collection of Biblical passages and Patristic Texts, with an easy option for modern translation.
f2-d: Elegant aesthetics with gold details and clean lines, focusing on spiritual tranquility.
f3-d: Designed to adapt perfectly to desktops, Android, and iOS devices.
f4-d: The 365orthodoxy widget is an interactive tool for searching and studying the Orthodox tradition.
inter-desc: The 365orthodoxy widget offers the following capabilities:
i1-d: Select any day via the calendar and see celebrated Saints and moveable feasts.
i2-d: Type a Saint's name to find when their memory is honored.
i3-d: Seeking instant inspiration? The widget easily displays a new passage for reflection.
i4-d: Easily share the daily message on social media and via email.
i5-d: Switch between Original and Modern version for deeper understanding.
i6-d: Special links to learn more about the lives of the Saints.
s1-d: Psalms of David, Gospels, Epistles of the Apostles, Proverbs of Solomon & Prophecies (Isaiah).
s2-d: Philokalia, St. Maximus the Confessor, St. John Chrysostom, St. Isaac the Syrian, St. Mark the Ascetic and St. John of the Ladder.
s3-d: Sayings of the Desert Fathers: Anthony the Great, Abbot Poemen, Abbot Sisoes, Abbot Macarius.
s4-d: St. Paisios the Athonite (on "good thoughts" and philotimo) and St. Porphyrios of Kavsokalyvia (on joy in Christ).
news-desc: The design is in its final stage. Subscribe to be the first to know!
